PageTitle: access gateway unnumbered loopback user-type ipoe
FuncDef:
The access gateway unnumbered loopback user-type ipoe command enables gateway unnumbered, so that common DHCP Layer 2 users can use IP addresses delivered by the RADIUS server but not in the domain address pool to go online.
The undo access gateway unnumbered loopback user-type ipoe command restores the default configuration.
By default, gateway unnumbered is disabled and common DHCP Layer 2 users can go online only if the IP addresses delivered by the RADIUS server are in the domain address pool.
CLIs: access gateway unnumbered loopback user-type ipoe
undo access gateway unnumbered loopback user-type ipoe
Examples: [~HUAWEI] access gateway unnumbered loopback user-type ipoe
ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
Generally, a RADIUS server delivers IP addresses in the domain address pool to common DHCP Layer 2 users. If the delivered IP addresses are not in the domain address pool, users cannot go online. To enable common DHCP Layer 2 users to go online with IP addresses delivered by the RADIUS server but not in the domain address pool, run the access gateway unnumbered loopback user-type ipoe command to enable gateway unnumbered first.
Precautions
In VS mode, this command is supported only by the admin VS.
Gateway unnumbered is enabled on a loopback interface using the access gateway unnumbered command in the loopback interface view.
